question:
Is there any evidence of a pneumothorax on the patient's chest X-ray? Please choose from the following two options: [yes, no]
<image>
variation_1:
Is there an apparent air collection surrounding the lung periphery on the chest X-ray, indicative of pneumothorax? Please choose from the following two options: [yes, no]
<image>
variation_2:
Is there any evidence of a pneumothorax on the patient's chest X-ray? Please choose from the following two options: [yes, no]
<image>
variation_3:
Does the radiographic image reveal a visible separation between the visceral and parietal pleurae with the presence of air in this space, suggesting a pneumothorax? Please choose from the following two options: [yes, no]
<image>
variation_4:
Is there any X-ray evidence of an air leak into the thoracic cavity, as demonstrated by a lucent area along the lung periphery, characteristic of pneumothorax? Please choose from the following two options: [yes, no]
<image>
variation_5:
On the chest X-ray, is there a visible gap between the outer and inner layers of the pleura with air trapped within this space, consistent with pneumothorax? Please choose from the following two options: [yes, no]
<image>
variation_6:
Does the radiograph display a distinctive clear area adjacent to the lung edge, indicating an accumulation of free air in the thoracic cavity due to pneumothorax? Please choose from the following two options: [yes, no]
<image>
variation_7:
Is there an apparent pleural fissure or separation visible on the chest X-ray, associated with an accumulation of air within the pleural space, indicative of pneumothorax? Please choose from the following two options: [yes, no]
<image>
variation_8:
On the provided radiograph, is there a clear indication of air entering and spreading throughout the thoracic cavity due to an air leak, suggestive of pneumothorax? Please choose from the following two options: [yes, no]
<image>
variation_9:
Does the chest X-ray reveal any signs of increased lucency or translucency adjacent to the lung periphery, indicative of free air in the pleural space and thus pneumothorax? Please choose from the following two options: [yes, no]
<image>
variation_10:
Is there an apparent discontinuity between the inner and outer pleural layers visible on the chest X-ray, suggesting a breach in the lung's integrity resulting in pneumothorax? Please choose from the following two options: [yes, no]
